com.team1829.library

Class CarbonRamp

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.team1829.library.CarbonRamp

  • public class CarbonRamp
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides a means to set a target value to slowly ramp up or down to. The ramp speed is dependent upon the delay between updates and the magnitude of the steps at each interval. The ramp will slowly increment from it's current value to the target value.
    Author:
    Nick Mosher, Team 1829 Carbonauts Captain

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static double RAMP_DEFAULT_STEPSIZE
      Default ramp step size is how much the ramp will step each iteration of tick().
      static long RAMP_DEFAULT_STEPTIME
      Default ramp step time is how long (in milliseconds) to wait between steps.
      static boolean RAMPS_DEFAULT_ENABLED
      Ramps are enabled by default.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CarbonRamp()
      Creates a CarbonRamp with an initial target of 0, with default step size and step time.
      CarbonRamp(double target)
      Creates a CarbonRamp with a custom initial target, with default step size and step time.
      CarbonRamp(double target, double stepSize, long stepTime)
      Creates a CarbonRamp with a custom initial target, step size, and step time.

    • Method Detail

      • tick

        public void tick()
        tick() must be run continuously in an execution loop (see CarbonRampCommand). The faster tick() is run the better, since that resolution will affect how closely the actual step times reflect the set step times. tick() will not freeze the execution flow by waiting for the step time, rather it will check if the step time has passed since the last step. If not it skips the execution, if so then it ticks the output by one step size toward the target, resets the step time, and continues.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Sets both the output and the target to 0, nullifying all action in this ramp. To reactivate, simply set a new target for the ramp.
